document.masterDocTitle: Camerobia and Neophyllobius (Acari: Prostigmata: Camerobiidae) from Australia, with the descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Camerobia and Neophyllobius (Acari: Prostigmata: Camerobiidae) from Australia, with the descriptions of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype , adult female, from under bark of
Eucalyptus
sp., Kaban, Atherton Tableland, Queensland, Australia , coll. R.V. Southcott,
24 Aug. 1944
. In SAM , J 9454 , ACC 329 .

Dorsum with 15 pairs of palmate setae; femora I–IV with 5, 4 , 2, 2 ; setae on genua clavate or lanceolate, ratio I: II: III: IV= 1.1: 1.1: 1.0: 1.0; tibiae I–IV each with 6 setae and an apical solenidion.

Gnathosoma. Stylophore stumpy; movable digits short; peritremes with 4 loops. Palp 26 ; counts of setae and solenidia from trochanter to tarsus: 0, 2 , 1, 1 + 1 claw, 1 + 1 eupathidium + 1 solenidion (). Subcapitular setae m 17 , distance m–m , 22 .

Idiosoma. Nearly circular in shape, 307 long, 272 wide. Prodorsum bearing 1 pair of eyes ( 12 in diameter), 1 pair of postocular bodies ( 14 in diameter) and 5 pairs of palmate setae, length x width: vi
19 x 18

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Camerobia australis Southcott
(adult female). A, dorsal view of idiosoma; B, ventral view of gnathosoma; C, dorsal idiosomal setae.

FIGURE 2.
Camerobia australis Southcott
(adult female). A, ventral view of idiosoma; B, setae on coxa I; C, tarsus I.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs. Length: leg I 332 , leg II 299 , leg III 316 , leg IV 345 . Setae on genua clavate or lanceolate, lengths:
I 30
, II
30 , III 27
, IV 28 . Tibiae I–IV each with a solenidion: I (incomplete), II ( 40 ), III (incomplete) and IV ( 33 ). Tarsi I–II each with a solenidion:
I 13
, II 13 . Counts of setae and solenidia on legs I–IV: coxae 2 + 1 elcI , 1, 2 , 2 ; trochanters 0, 1 , 1, 1 ; femora 5, 4 , 2, 2 ; genua 1 + 1, 1 + 1, 1 , 1 ; tibiae 6 + 1, 6 + 1, 6 + 1, 6 + 1 ; tarsi 8 + 1, 8 + 1, 7 , 7 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Camerobia australis Southcott
(adult female). A, leg I; B, leg II; C, leg III; D, leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Bolland ( 1986 )
redescribed the adult female of
C. australis
based on a paratype specimen in his revision of the family Camerobiidae . According to his description the animal is slightly smaller than the holotype redescribed here, but his other measurements are very similar to those we measured on the holotype .
